title: AnIML
description: ComplexType for the root element of an AnIML document. The AnIML element serves as the container for all data and metadata in an analytical data file. It contains version information, sample definitions, experimental data organized in steps, and an audit trail of changes made to the document.

audit_trail_entry_set.title: audit_trail_entry_set
audit_trail_entry_set.description: Container for audit trail entries describing changes to this document.

experiment_step_set.title: experiment_step_set
experiment_step_set.description: Container for multiple ExperimentSteps that describe the process and results.

sample_set.title: sample_set
sample_set.description: Container for Samples used in this AnIML document.

version.title: version
version.description: Version number of the AnIML Core Schema used in this document. Must be '0.90'.

AuditTrailEntry.title: AuditTrailEntry
AuditTrailEntry.description: Describes a set of changes made to the particular AnIML document by one user at a given time. The AuditTrailEntry element captures the complete context of a document modification event, including who made the change, when it occurred, what software was used, and both human-readable and machine-readable descriptions of the changes. This enables full traceability of document history.

author.title: author
author.description: Information about a person, a device or a piece of software authoring AnIML files.

comment.title: comment
comment.description: Human-readable comment further explaining the changes.

reference.title: reference
reference.description: ID of the SignableItem that was affected. If none is specified, entire document is covered.

AuditTrailEntrySet.title: AuditTrailEntrySet
AuditTrailEntrySet.description: Container for audit trail entries describing changes to this document. The AuditTrailEntrySet maintains a chronological record of all modifications made to the AnIML document, including who made the changes, when they were made, and what specific changes occurred. This provides full traceability and compliance with data integrity requirements.

audit_trail_entry.title: audit_trail_entry
audit_trail_entry.description: Describes a set of changes made to the particular AnIML document by one user at a given time.

Author.title: Author
Author.description: Information about a person, a device or a piece of software authoring AnIML files. Authors can be human users, automated systems, or software applications that create or modify AnIML documents. This flexible definition supports both manual and automated workflows while maintaining clear provenance.

affiliation.title: affiliation
affiliation.description: Organization the Author is affiliated with.

role.title: role
role.description: Role the Author plays within the organization.

AutoIncrementedValueSet.title: AutoIncrementedValueSet
AutoIncrementedValueSet.description: Multiple values given in form of a start value and an increment. This element provides an efficient way to represent regular sequences of numeric values without storing each individual value.

end_index.title: end_index
end_index.description: Zero-based index of the last entry in this Value Set. The specification is inclusive.

start_index.title: start_index
start_index.description: Zero-based index of the first entry in this Value Set. The specification is inclusive.

start_value.title: start_value
start_value.description: Lower boundary of an interval or ValueSet.

Category.title: Category
Category.description: Defines a category of Parameters and SeriesSets. Used to model hierarchies. Categories enable logical grouping and organization of experimental data and parameters, supporting complex data structures while maintaining clear relationships between elements.

category.title: category
category.description: Defines a category of Parameters and SeriesSets. Used to model hierarchies.

Device.title: Device
Device.description: Device used to perform experiment. This element captures detailed information about laboratory instruments and equipment used in experiments, supporting traceability and reproducibility requirements.

device_identifier.title: device_identifier
device_identifier.description: Unique name or identifier of the device.

Diff.title: Diff
Diff.description: Machine-readable description of changes made. Diffs provide a detailed record of modifications made to an AnIML document, enabling precise tracking of what was changed, when, and by whom. This supports audit trails and change management requirements.

changed_item.title: changed_item
changed_item.description: ID of the SignableItem that was changed

scope.title: scope
scope.description: Scope of diff. May be 'element' or 'attribute'.

EncodedValueSet.title: EncodedValueSet
EncodedValueSet.description: Multiple numeric values encoded as a base64 binary string. Uses little-endian byte order. This element provides efficient storage of large numeric datasets through binary encoding.

end_index.title: end_index
end_index.description: Zero-based index of the last entry in this Value Set. The specification is inclusive.

start_index.title: start_index
start_index.description: Zero-based index of the first entry in this Value Set. The specification is inclusive.

EndValue.title: EndValue
EndValue.description: Upper boundary of an interval. This element works with StartValue to define precise numeric ranges for data selection and reference.

value.title: value
value.description: I: Individual integer value (32 bits, signed). L: Individual long integer value (64 bits, signed). F: Individual 32-bit floating point value. D: Individual 64-bit floating point value.

ExperimentDataBulkReference.title: ExperimentDataBulkReference
ExperimentDataBulkReference.description: Prefix-based reference to a set of Experiment Steps whose data are consumed. This element enables efficient referencing of multiple related experimental steps through pattern matching.

ExperimentDataReference.title: ExperimentDataReference
ExperimentDataReference.description: Reference to an Experiment Step whose data is consumed. This element creates explicit links between experimental steps, documenting how data flows through multi-step experimental procedures.

ExperimentDataReferenceSet.title: ExperimentDataReferenceSet
ExperimentDataReferenceSet.description: Set of Experiment Steps consumed by this Experiment Step. This element manages dependencies between different experimental steps, allowing for complex workflows where the output of one step becomes input for another.

experiment_data_bulk_reference.title: experiment_data_bulk_reference
experiment_data_bulk_reference.description: Prefix-based reference to a set of Experiment Steps whose data are consumed.

experiment_data_reference.title: experiment_data_reference
experiment_data_reference.description: Reference to an Experiment Step whose data is consumed.

ExperimentStep.title: ExperimentStep
ExperimentStep.description: Container that documents a step in an experiment. Use one ExperimentStep per application of a Technique. ExperimentSteps are the fundamental building blocks of an AnIML document, capturing the complete context, method, and results of a single experimental procedure or measurement.

comment.title: comment
comment.description: Unstructured text comment to further describe the ExperimentStep.

experiment_step_id.title: experiment_step_id
experiment_step_id.description: Unique identifier for this ExperimentStep. Used to point to this step from an ExperimentDataReference.

infrastructure.title: infrastructure
infrastructure.description: Contains references to the context of this Experiment.

method.title: method
method.description: Describes how this Experiment was performed.

result.title: result
result.description: Container for Data derived from Experiment.

source_data_location.title: source_data_location
source_data_location.description: Points to the original data source. May be a file name, uri, database ID, etc.

technique.title: technique
technique.description: Reference to Technique Definition used in this Experiment.

ExperimentStepSet.title: ExperimentStepSet
ExperimentStepSet.description: Container for multiple ExperimentSteps that describe the process and results. The ExperimentStepSet organizes the analytical workflow into discrete steps, where each step represents the application of a specific analytical technique. This structure allows for clear documentation of complex, multi-step analytical procedures while maintaining relationships between steps.

experiment_step.title: experiment_step
experiment_step.description: Container that documents a step in an experiment. Use one ExperimentStep per application of a Technique.

template.title: template
template.description: Represents a template for an ExperimentStep.

Extension.title: Extension
Extension.description: Reference to an Extension to amend the active Technique Definition. Extensions allow for customization and enhancement of standard Technique Definitions while maintaining compatibility with the base specification.

name.title: name
name.description: Name of Extension to be used. Must match Name given in Extension Definition file.

sha256.title: sha256
sha256.description: SHA256 checksum of the referenced Extension. Hex encoded, lower cased. Similar to the output of the sha256 unix command.

uri.title: uri
uri.description: URI where Extension file can be fetched.

Increment.title: Increment
Increment.description: Increment value. This element specifies the step size for AutoIncrementedValueSets, enabling efficient representation of regular numeric sequences.

value.title: value
value.description: I: Individual integer value (32 bits, signed). L: Individual long integer value (64 bits, signed). F: Individual 32-bit floating point value. D: Individual 64-bit floating point value.

IndividualValueSet.title: IndividualValueSet
IndividualValueSet.description: Multiple Values explicitly specified. This element provides direct storage of data values, supporting multiple data types for maximum flexibility.

end_index.title: end_index
end_index.description: Zero-based index of the last entry in this Value Set. The specification is inclusive.

start_index.title: start_index
start_index.description: Zero-based index of the first entry in this Value Set. The specification is inclusive.

values.title: values
values.description: I: Individual integer value (32 bits, signed). L: Individual long integer value (64 bits, signed). F: Individual 32-bit floating point value. D: Individual 64-bit floating point value. S: Individual string value. Boolean: Individual boolean value.

Infrastructure.title: Infrastructure
Infrastructure.description: Contains references to the context of this Experiment. Infrastructure elements provide the broader experimental context by linking to samples, related experiments, and temporal information. This creates a web of relationships between different experimental components.

experiment_data_reference_set.title: experiment_data_reference_set
experiment_data_reference_set.description: Set of Experiment Steps consumed by this Experiment Step.

parent_data_point_reference_set.title: parent_data_point_reference_set
parent_data_point_reference_set.description: Contains references to the parent Result.

sample_reference_set.title: sample_reference_set
sample_reference_set.description: Set of Samples used in this Experiment.

Method.title: Method
Method.description: Describes how this Experiment was performed. Methods document the complete experimental procedure, including the people involved, equipment used, and software settings. This comprehensive record ensures experiments can be understood and potentially reproduced.

author.title: author
author.description: Information about a person, a device or a piece of software authoring AnIML files.

category.title: category
category.description: Defines a category of Parameters and SeriesSets. Used to model hierarchies.

name.title: name
name.description: Optional method name, as defined in the instrument software.

Parameter.title: Parameter
Parameter.description: Name/Value Pair. Parameters store individual data points and experimental settings, supporting multiple data types and optional units for complete scientific documentation.

unit.title: unit
unit.description: Unit: Definition of a Scientific Unit.

value.title: value
value.description: I: Individual integer value (32 bits, signed). L: Individual long integer value (64 bits, signed). F: Individual 32-bit floating point value. D: Individual 64-bit floating point value. S: Individual string value. Boolean: Individual boolean value.

ParentDataPointReference.title: ParentDataPointReference
ParentDataPointReference.description: Reference to a data point or value range in an independent Series in the parent Result. This element enables precise linking between specific data points across different experimental steps.

series_id.title: series_id
series_id.description: Contains the ID of the Series referenced.

start_value.title: start_value
start_value.description: Lower boundary of an interval or ValueSet.

ParentDataPointReferenceSet.title: ParentDataPointReferenceSet
ParentDataPointReferenceSet.description: Contains references to the parent Result. This element enables precise linking between related data points across different experimental steps, supporting detailed tracking of data relationships and dependencies.

parent_data_point_reference.title: parent_data_point_reference
parent_data_point_reference.description: Reference to a data point or value range in an independent Series in the parent Result.

Result.title: Result
Result.description: Container for Data derived from Experiment. Results store the actual experimental data along with its organization into series and categories. This structured approach allows for clear representation of both simple and complex multidimensional datasets.

category.title: category
category.description: Defines a category of Parameters and SeriesSets. Used to model hierarchies.

SIUnit.title: SIUnit
SIUnit.description: Combination of SI Units used to represent Scientific unit. This element enables precise specification of complex scientific units through combinations of base SI units.

Sample.title: Sample
Sample.description: Individual Sample, referenced from other parts of this AnIML document. The Sample element provides comprehensive documentation of a physical or virtual sample, including its identification, physical location, containment hierarchy, and any relevant metadata. It supports both simple samples and complex container-based sample organizations like well plates.

barcode.title: barcode
barcode.description: Value of barcode label that is attached to sample container.

category.title: category
category.description: Defines a category of Parameters and SeriesSets. Used to model hierarchies.

comment.title: comment
comment.description: Unstructured text comment to further describe the Sample.

container_id.title: container_id
container_id.description: Sample ID of container in which this sample is located.

container_type.title: container_type
container_type.description: Whether this sample is also a container for other samples. Set to 'simple' if not.

derived.title: derived
derived.description: Indicates whether this is a derived Sample. A derived Sample is a Sample that has been created by applying a Technique. (Sub-Sampling, Processing, ...)

location_in_container.title: location_in_container
location_in_container.description: Coordinates of this sample within the enclosing container. In case of microplates or trays, the row is identified by letters and the column is identified by numbers (1-based) while in landscape orientation. Examples: A10 = 1st row, 10th column, Z1 = 26th row, 1st column, AB2 = 28th row, 2nd column.

source_data_location.title: source_data_location
source_data_location.description: Points to the original data source. May be a file name, uri, database ID, etc.

SampleInheritance.title: SampleInheritance
SampleInheritance.description: Indicates that a Sample was inherited from the parent ExperimentStep. This element supports tracking sample lineage through multi-step experimental procedures.

role.title: role
role.description: Role this sample plays within the current ExperimentStep.

sample_purpose.title: sample_purpose
sample_purpose.description: Specifies whether the referenced sample is produced or consumed by the current ExperimentStep.

SampleReference.title: SampleReference
SampleReference.description: Reference to a Sample used in this Experiment. This element creates explicit links between experiments and samples, documenting how samples are used or transformed during experimental procedures.

role.title: role
role.description: Role this sample plays within the current ExperimentStep.

sample_id.title: sample_id
sample_id.description: SampleID of the Sample used in the current ExperimentStep. Refers to the sampleID within the SampleSet section of the document.

sample_purpose.title: sample_purpose
sample_purpose.description: Specifies whether the referenced sample is produced or consumed by the current ExperimentStep.

SampleReferenceSet.title: SampleReferenceSet
SampleReferenceSet.description: Set of Samples used in this Experiment. This element manages relationships between experiments and samples, tracking both sample usage and sample transformations throughout experimental workflows.

sample_inheritance.title: sample_inheritance
sample_inheritance.description: Indicates that a Sample was inherited from the parent ExperimentStep.

sample_reference.title: sample_reference
sample_reference.description: Reference to a Sample used in this Experiment.

SampleSet.title: SampleSet
SampleSet.description: Container for Samples used in this AnIML document. The SampleSet element acts as a registry of all samples referenced throughout the document, allowing samples to be defined once and referenced multiple times. This centralized approach ensures consistency in sample identification and properties across the entire analytical workflow.

sample.title: sample
sample.description: Individual Sample, referenced from other parts of this AnIML document.

Series.title: Series
Series.description: Container for multiple Values. Series elements store ordered collections of data points, supporting multiple data types and optional units while maintaining relationships between dependent and independent variables.

dependency.title: dependency
dependency.description: Specified whether the Series is independent or dependent.

plot_scale.title: plot_scale
plot_scale.description: Specifies whether the data in this Series is typically plotted on a linear or logarithmic scale.

series_id.title: series_id
series_id.description: Identifies the Series. Used in References from subordinate ExperimentSteps. Unique per SeriesSet.

series_type.title: series_type
series_type.description: Data type used by all values in this Series.

value_set.title: value_set
value_set.description: IndividualValueSet: Multiple Values explicitly specified. EncodedValueSet: Multiple numeric values encoded as a base64 binary string. Uses little-endian byte order. AutoIncrementedValueSet: Multiple values given in form of a start value and an increment.

visible.title: visible
visible.description: Specifies whether data in this Series is to be displayed to the user by default.

SeriesSet.title: SeriesSet
SeriesSet.description: Container for n-dimensional Data. SeriesSets organize related data series into logical groups, supporting both simple linear data and complex multi-dimensional datasets while maintaining clear relationships between dependent and independent variables.

length.title: length
length.description: Number of data points each Series contains.

Software.title: Software
Software.description: Software used to author this. This element captures details about software applications involved in creating or modifying AnIML documents, including version information and operating environment details for reproducibility and troubleshooting.

operating_system.title: operating_system
operating_system.description: Operating system the software was running on.

StartValue.title: StartValue
StartValue.description: Lower boundary of an interval or ValueSet. This element works with EndValue to define precise numeric ranges for data selection and reference.

value.title: value
value.description: I: Individual integer value (32 bits, signed). L: Individual long integer value (64 bits, signed). F: Individual 32-bit floating point value. D: Individual 64-bit floating point value.

Tag.title: Tag
Tag.description: Tag to mark related data items. When a value is given, it may also serve as a reference to an external data system. Tags provide a flexible way to add metadata, create groupings, or link to external systems while maintaining the structured nature of AnIML documents.

TagSet.title: TagSet
TagSet.description: Set of Tag elements. TagSets provide a flexible mechanism for adding metadata and classifications to AnIML elements. They can be used to group related items, add external references, or implement custom categorization schemes.

tag.title: tag
tag.description: Tag to mark related data items. When a value is given, it may also serve as a reference to an external data system.

Technique.title: Technique
Technique.description: Reference to Technique Definition used in this Experiment. Techniques define the standardized structure and vocabulary for specific types of experimental procedures. This reference system ensures consistent data organization across different implementations of the same technique.

extension.title: extension
extension.description: Reference to an Extension to amend the active Technique Definition.

sha256.title: sha256
sha256.description: SHA256 checksum of the referenced Technique Definition. Hex encoded, lower cased. Similar to the output of the sha256 unix command.

uri.title: uri
uri.description: URI where Technique Definition file can be fetched.

Template.title: Template
Template.description: Represents a template for an ExperimentStep. Templates provide a reusable pattern for creating ExperimentSteps with predefined structure and metadata. They help ensure consistency across similar experimental procedures.

infrastructure.title: infrastructure
infrastructure.description: Contains references to the context of this Experiment.

method.title: method
method.description: Describes how this Experiment was performed.

result.title: result
result.description: Container for Data derived from Experiment.

source_data_location.title: source_data_location
source_data_location.description: Points to the original data source. May be a file name, uri, database ID, etc.

technique.title: technique
technique.description: Reference to Technique Definition used in this Experiment.

Unit.title: Unit
Unit.description: Definition of a Scientific Unit. This element provides a structured way to specify scientific units, supporting both simple units and complex combinations of SI units.

label.title: label
label.description: Defines the visual representation of a particular Unit.

quantity.title: quantity
quantity.description: Quantity the unit can be applied to

si_unit.title: si_unit
si_unit.description: Combination of SI Units used to represent Scientific unit
